page.title: 09THE HEADMASTER OF THE SCHOOL
page.content: Mr Torkington told us he has been teaching for 28 years. He has taught in this school for five and half years. He lives in the village and walks to school. He likes his work. Mr Torkington has used the cane in other schools but never in this school. There are 2 full time teachers for infants and junior classes. Mr Torkington teaches transition class There is secretary,a cleaner, a caretaker,a cook, 2 assistants and two supervisory staff.There are 58 boys & girls. The school was built in 1863. In 1983 2 temporary classrooms were added.The old Schoolhouse adjoining no longer belongs to the school.The school & gamesfield belong to Hampshire County Council.About Â£1000 a year are spent on equipment and books.
